title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a solid line because the inequality sign is $$ \geq $$.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y \geq \frac{-2}{3} x+2$$ \\n $$0 \geq 0\frac{-2}{3}+2$$ \\n $$0 \geq 2$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is not a solution to $$y \geq \frac{-2}{3} x+2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, we shade the right side of the boundary line in red.\n##figure4.gif##

title: Graph the Boundary Line
text: It is a dashed line because the inequality sign is >.

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: A test point should be a point not on the line. Choose (0,0) as a test point to see if it is a solution. \\n $$y>2x-3$$ \\n $$0>2\times0-3$$ \\n $$0>-3$$

title: Shade in the Side of the Boundary Line
text: (0,0) is a solution to $$y \geq \frac{-2}{3} x+2$$. Since (0,0) is on the left side of the line, so we shade in the left side of the line $$y=\frac{-2}{3} x+2$$ in green.\n##figure8.gif##

title: Overlap Shading
text: The solution is all points in the darker shaded region.
